content: the pacifica beanie is a crochet pattern for a beanie for men the hat is quick to make it calls for worsted weight yarn the sample hat uses knitpicks/wecrochet brava tweed the pattern includes written instructions using standard united states crochet terminology it has been tech-edited and tested sizing and gauge size one size adult large finished measurements 17 in circumference at brim and 9 tall with 2 brim folded up gauge 16 sts and 8 row = 4 in pattern of alternating row of half_double_crochet blo and double_crochet blo for body of hat crochet supplies needed yarn worsted weight #4 medium in color of choice approximately 200 yards shown knitpicks/wecrochet brava tweed worsted 97% premium acrylic 3% viscose 218 yd 200 m / 3 5 oz 100 g #641427 mink approximately 1 skein crochet hook size size h/8 5 00 mm or size needed to obtain gauge notions tapestry needle tape measure stitch key chain = chain double_crochet = double_crochet double_crochet blo = double_crochet back loop only half_double_crochet blo = half_double_crochet back loop only st s = stitch es repeat = repeat hat construction hat is crocheted as a flat rectangle of ribbing then the rectangle is seamed together to make a tube then the top of the hat is closed and the brim can be turned up please note that the pattern is available for free on my blog the benefit of purchasing this pdf pattern is to receive an ad-free version that is easy to print and read this pattern does not include a video or photo tutorial if you have any questions while you are working on your project please feel free to email me at crafting pattern@gmail com and i will do my best to answer your questions and give you help please note that it is expected that you know how to crochet and to read a pattern using
